meta.notes: Synthetic dataset: programs, courses, faculty, admissions, fees, scholarships, FAQs, placements, hostel, contacts, events, policies, announcements and Q&A pairs.

programs.name: B.Tech in Artificial Intelligence
programs.description: Undergraduate engineering program focusing on machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, and NLP with industry projects.
programs.eligibility_summary: 10+2 with PCM, minimum 60% aggregate or JEE Main score as per institute cutoff

programs.name: B.Design (Industrial Design)
programs.description: Design program focused on product design, user experience, and prototyping. Portfolio required for admission.
programs.eligibility_summary: 10+2 in any stream; portfolio required; design entrance test.

programs.name: MBA (Business Analytics)
programs.description: Postgraduate program combining business fundamentals with data analytics, statistical modeling, and practical industry projects.
programs.eligibility_summary: Bachelor's degree with minimum 50%; CAT / MAT / XAT / Institute entrance test.

programs.name: BA in Media & Journalism
programs.description: Covers reporting, multimedia journalism, ethics, and media law with hands-on studio practice.
programs.eligibility_summary: 10+2 in any stream; personal interview for shortlisted candidates.

programs.name: M.Tech in Computer Science
programs.description: Advanced program with research and elective tracks in distributed systems, ML, and cybersecurity.
programs.eligibility_summary: B.Tech or equivalent in relevant discipline; GATE preferred.

programs.name: B.Com (Honours)
programs.description: Commerce program with specialization options in finance, accounting, and taxation.
programs.eligibility_summary: 10+2 in commerce or equivalent with minimum 50%.

courses.title: Machine Learning
courses.short_description: Supervised and unsupervised learning, evaluation metrics, model selection, and practical labs.

courses.title: Deep Learning
courses.short_description: Neural networks, CNNs, RNNs, transformers, and project work.

courses.title: Design Thinking & Ideation
courses.short_description: Human-centered design, prototyping methods, case studies.

courses.title: Business Statistics
courses.short_description: Descriptive statistics, probability distributions, hypothesis testing.

courses.title: News Reporting & Writing
courses.short_description: Basics of news gathering, ethics, and writing for print and digital.

courses.title: Advanced Cybersecurity
courses.short_description: Network security, crypto primitives, secure systems design.

courses.title: Financial Accounting
courses.short_description: Accounting principles, ledgers, and financial statements.

courses.title: Prototyping & Materials
courses.short_description: Physical prototyping, material selection, CAD basics.

courses.title: Case Methods in Analytics
courses.short_description: Business case analysis using quantitative tools.

courses.title: Media Law and Ethics
courses.short_description: Media regulation, defamation, privacy and ethical reporting.

courses.title: Research Methods
courses.short_description: Research design, literature review, and scientific writing.

application_steps: Upload 10+2 mark sheet and photo ID

admissions.notes: B.Design applicants must upload a 10-page PDF portfolio; accepted formats: PDF; max size 10MB.

process: Apply online for hostel within 7 days of admission

admissions.notes: Subject to availability and eligibility; requires transcripts and NOC from previous institute.

fees.refund_policy: Full refund within 7 days; after 30 days no refund
Full refund within 10 days; prorated refund within first 30 days

scholarships.name: Merit Scholarship - Top 10
scholarships.eligibility: Top 10 rank holders in entrance/merit list

scholarships.name: Need-based Assistance
scholarships.benefit: Up to 75% tuition support subject to verification

scholarships.name: Women in STEM Scholarship
scholarships.eligibility: Female students enrolling in engineering or CS programs

faqs.question: When do applications for undergraduate programs close?
faqs.answer: For 2025, undergraduate applications close on June 30, 2025. Always confirm the dates on the admissions page as they may change.

faqs.question: Do I need a portfolio for B.Design?
faqs.answer: Yes. B.Design applicants must submit a 10-page PDF portfolio demonstrating design projects, sketches, and process work.

faqs.question: What is the fee refund policy?
faqs.answer: Full refund if withdrawn within 7-10 days (program dependent). After 30 days, refunds are typically not provided. Check the program fee page for exact timelines.

faqs.question: How do I apply for hostel accommodation?
faqs.answer: Apply within 7 days of admission via the student portal and pay the hostel deposit to confirm your seat.

faqs.question: What are the placement statistics?
faqs.answer: Placement stats vary by program; the latest placement report is published annually. Example: Computer Science average package (2024): ₹7.2 LPA.

faqs.question: Does the college help with internships?
faqs.answer: Yes. The placement cell maintains internship listings and assists students with applications and resume review.

faqs.question: What to do in a medical emergency on campus?
faqs.answer: Contact campus medical center at +91-79-XXXXXXX or visit the medical clinic located near the north gate. Emergency ambulance services are available.

faqs.question: How can I contact admissions?
faqs.answer: Email admissions@example.edu or call +91-79-YYYYYYYY during office hours (Mon-Fri 9:30am-5:30pm).

faqs.question: What is the exam re-evaluation procedure?
faqs.answer: Students can apply for re-evaluation within 10 days of results announcement by submitting the form and paying the fee.

faqs.question: How to apply for scholarships?
faqs.answer: Most scholarships require an online application, supporting documents, and income proof where applicable.

placements.guidelines: Students must register internships through the placement portal. Internship credits are awarded after supervisor evaluation.

rules: Curfew at 11:00pm for undergraduates on weekdays

events.title: TechFest 2025
events.description: Annual technical festival with hackathons, workshops, and guest talks.

events.title: Design Showcase
events.description: Student design exhibition highlighting final-year projects.

events.title: Internship Fair
events.description: Companies and startups present internship opportunities to students.

events.title: Resume & Interview Workshop
events.description: Hands-on workshop run by placement cell and industry mentors.

policies.title: Attendance Policy
policies.summary: Students must maintain minimum 75% attendance to be eligible for end semester exams. Medical exemptions require documentation.

policies.title: Academic Integrity Policy
policies.summary: Plagiarism and cheating are punishable; re-exams or disciplinary actions may be taken.

policies.title: Fee Refund Policy
policies.summary: Full refund within 7-10 days depending on program; partial refunds limited within first 30 days.

announcements.title: Semester 2 Exam Schedule Released
announcements.content: Semester 2 exam schedule is available on the student portal. Check your department page for venue and timing.

announcements.title: Hostel Vacancies for Spring
announcements.content: Limited hostel seats available for Spring semester. Apply via the hostel portal by Sep 30, 2025.

announcements.title: Internship Fair Reminder
announcements.content: Internship Fair on Sep 15. Register on the placement portal by Sep 13, 2025.

qa_pairs.question: What programs do you offer in engineering?
qa_pairs.answer: We offer B.Tech programs including B.Tech in Artificial Intelligence and M.Tech in Computer Science. See the programs list for details.

qa_pairs.question: What is the eligibility for B.Tech in Artificial Intelligence?
qa_pairs.answer: Eligibility: 10+2 with Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics with a minimum 60% aggregate or a qualifying JEE Main score as per institute cutoff.

qa_pairs.question: Do B.Design applicants need a portfolio?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes. B.Design applicants must submit a 10-page PDF portfolio demonstrating design projects and sketches. Maximum size 10MB.

qa_pairs.question: When do undergraduate applications close?
qa_pairs.answer: Undergraduate applications close on June 30, 2025 for the 2025 intake.

qa_pairs.question: How do I apply for hostel accommodation?
qa_pairs.answer: Apply within 7 days of admission via the student portal and pay the hostel deposit to confirm your seat.

qa_pairs.question: What is the tuition fee for B.Tech AI?
qa_pairs.answer: The tuition fee for B.Tech in Artificial Intelligence is ₹1,80,000 per year.

qa_pairs.question: Are scholarships available for merit students?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes. Merit Scholarship - Top 10 offers a 50% tuition waiver for top 10 rank holders.

qa_pairs.question: How do I contact the placement cell?
qa_pairs.answer: Email placements@example.edu or visit the Placement Cell in Room 210, Admin Block.

qa_pairs.question: What are the hostel types and costs?
qa_pairs.answer: Hostel Block A is single occupancy at ₹60,000/year; Block B is shared (3 per room) at ₹42,000/year.

qa_pairs.question: Who teaches Machine Learning?
qa_pairs.answer: Dr. Meera Sharma, Associate Professor in Computer Science, specializes in Machine Learning and NLP.

qa_pairs.question: What is the refund policy?
qa_pairs.answer: Full refund if withdrawn within 7-10 days depending on the program; after 30 days refunds are typically not provided.

qa_pairs.question: When is TechFest 2025?
qa_pairs.answer: TechFest 2025 is scheduled for October 12, 2025.

qa_pairs.question: How do I apply for scholarships?
qa_pairs.answer: Most scholarships require an online application with supporting documents such as income proof and transcripts.

qa_pairs.question: Does the college help with internships?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes. The placement cell maintains internship listings and assists students with applications and resume review.

qa_pairs.question: What is the average package for CS in 2024?
qa_pairs.answer: Example: Computer Science average package (2024): ₹7.2 LPA.

qa_pairs.question: How many credits is the Capstone Project?
qa_pairs.answer: The Capstone Project (AI499) is 8 credits and typically taken in semester 8.

qa_pairs.question: What documents are required for admissions?
qa_pairs.answer: Common documents: 10+2 marksheet, photo ID, passport-size photograph, transfer certificate (if applicable). See admissions page for full list.

qa_pairs.question: What are office hours for the admissions office?
qa_pairs.answer: Admissions office hours are Monday to Friday 9:30am to 5:30pm.

qa_pairs.question: How to request a re-evaluation of exam results?
qa_pairs.answer: Apply for re-evaluation within 10 days of results announcement by submitting the form and paying the fee.

qa_pairs.question: Is there a medical center on campus?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes. Campus Medical Center is available 24x7. Contact +91-79-88889999.

qa_pairs.question: What is the attendance requirement?
qa_pairs.answer: Students must maintain minimum 75% attendance to be eligible for end semester exams; medical exemptions require documentation.

qa_pairs.question: When are placement activities conducted?
qa_pairs.answer: Pre-placement talks occur Aug-Sep, application window Sep-Oct, and final placements typically Nov-Dec.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact for IT help?
qa_pairs.answer: Contact IT Helpdesk at ithelp@example.edu or phone +91-79-33332222 during office hours.

qa_pairs.question: Can I transfer credits from another university?
qa_pairs.answer: Lateral entry or transfers are subject to availability and require transcripts and an NOC from the previous institute.

qa_pairs.question: What is the policy on plagiarism?
qa_pairs.answer: Plagiarism and cheating are punishable under the Academic Integrity Policy; penalties may include re-exams or disciplinary action.

qa_pairs.question: Are there clubs and societies?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes. The university has multiple clubs: coding club, design society, media club, entrepreneurship cell, and more.

qa_pairs.question: How to find library timings?
qa_pairs.answer: Library timings are Monday-Saturday 9:00am to 8:00pm. Contact library@example.edu for more details.

qa_pairs.question: What is the application fee?
qa_pairs.answer: The application processing fee is ₹1,200 and is non-refundable.

qa_pairs.question: How to register for the Internship Fair?
qa_pairs.answer: Register via the placement portal by the date specified in the internship fair announcement.

qa_pairs.question: Do you provide placement handbooks?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes. Placement resources and handbooks are available; see placement_resources_handbook.pdf.

qa_pairs.question: How to check my exam venue?
qa_pairs.answer: Exam venue details are posted on the student portal and department notice boards; check the Semester 2 exam schedule announcement.

qa_pairs.question: What is the Women in STEM scholarship?
qa_pairs.answer: Women in STEM Scholarship offers a 20% tuition waiver for eligible female students enrolling in engineering or CS programs.

qa_pairs.question: Are there industry projects in curriculum?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes. Programs like B.Tech AI include industry-linked projects and a capstone project in the final year.

qa_pairs.question: How to contact hostel warden?
qa_pairs.answer: Hostel wardens: Block A +91-79-AAAABBBB; Block B +91-79-CCCCDDDD.

qa_pairs.question: What is the maximum portfolio size for B.Design?
qa_pairs.answer: Maximum portfolio size is 10MB; submit as a 10-page PDF.

qa_pairs.question: Where is the placement office located?
qa_pairs.answer: Placement Cell is located in Room 210, Admin Block.

qa_pairs.question: What is the highest package in 2024?
qa_pairs.answer: The highest package recorded in 2024 was ₹18 LPA.

qa_pairs.question: How are internship credits evaluated?
qa_pairs.answer: Internship credits are awarded after supervisor evaluation and submission of a final report.

qa_pairs.question: Can I defer admission?
qa_pairs.answer: Admission deferral is considered on a case-by-case basis and requires formal application to the admissions office.

qa_pairs.question: Who handles placements for B.Des students?
qa_pairs.answer: Placement cell handles placements for all programs; design-specific recruiters are coordinated with the Design department.
